Download microdata of death records from Brazil's census

Source: R/read_deaths.R
read_deaths.Rd

Download microdata of death records from Brazil's census. Data collected in the sample component of the questionnaire.

read_deaths(
  year = 2010,
  columns = NULL,
  as_data_frame = FALSE,
  showProgress = TRUE,
  cache = TRUE
)

Arguments

year

Numeric. Year of reference in the format yyyymm. Defaults to 2010.

columns

String. A vector of column names to keep. The rest of the columns are not read. Defaults to NULL and read all columns.

as_data_frame

Logical. Whether the function should return a data.frame or an Arrow Table (Default).

showProgress

Logical. Defaults to TRUE display download progress bar. The progress bar only reflects only the downloading time, not the time to load the data to memory.

cache

Logical. Whether the function should read the data cached locally in future calls, which is much faster. Defaults to TRUE. If FALSE, the function will download the file from the internet.

Value

An ArrowObject Dataset or a "data.frame" object.

See also

Other download microdata: read_emmigration(), read_families(), read_households(), read_population()

Examples

# return data as arrow table
df <- read_deaths(year = 2010)
#>

# return data as data.frame
df <- read_deaths(year = 2010, as_data_frame = TRUE)
head(df)
